Package com.salesforce.multicloudj.common.retries

Class RetryConfig

java.lang.Object
com.salesforce.multicloudj.common.retries.RetryConfig
public final class RetryConfig extends Object
Cloud-agnostic retry configuration for MultiCloudJ services.

This configuration provides a unified retry strategy that can be applied across all supported cloud providers and services. It abstracts provider-specific retry mechanisms into a common model that can be translated to native retry configurations for each cloud provider.

Supports two retry modes:

  • EXPONENTIAL: Delay between retries grows exponentially using the formula: delay = min(maxDelayMillis, initialDelayMillis * multiplier^(attempt-1))
  • FIXED: Constant delay between retries using fixedDelayMillis

Example usage: 


 // Exponential backoff with 3 retries
 RetryConfig exponentialConfig = RetryConfig.builder()
     .mode(RetryConfig.Mode.EXPONENTIAL)
     .maxAttempts(3)
     .initialDelayMillis(100L)
     .multiplier(2.0)
     .maxDelayMillis(5000L)
     .attemptTimeout(5000L)
     .totalTimeout(30000L)
     .build();

 // Fixed delay with 5 retries
 RetryConfig fixedConfig = RetryConfig.builder()
     .mode(RetryConfig.Mode.FIXED)
     .maxAttempts(5)
     .fixedDelayMillis(1000L)
     .build();

  • Method Details

    • builder

      public static RetryConfig.RetryConfigBuilder builder()

    • getMode

      public RetryConfig.Mode getMode()
      The retry mode determining delay calculation strategy.

    • getMaxAttempts

      public Integer getMaxAttempts()
      Maximum number of attempts including the initial request. For example, maxAttempts = 3 means 1 initial attempt + 2 retries. If null, the cloud provider's default will be used.

    • getInitialDelayMillis

      public long getInitialDelayMillis()
      Initial delay in milliseconds before the first retry (EXPONENTIAL mode only). This is the base delay that gets multiplied by multiplier^(attempt-1).

    • getMultiplier

      public double getMultiplier()
      Multiplier for exponential backoff (EXPONENTIAL mode only). Each retry delay is calculated as: initialDelayMillis * multiplier^(attempt-1). Common values: 2.0 for doubling delay, Default will be 2.0 if you don't specific it. AWS is always 2.0

    • getMaxDelayMillis

      public long getMaxDelayMillis()
      Maximum delay cap in milliseconds (EXPONENTIAL mode only). Prevents delay from growing indefinitely by capping it at this value.

    • getFixedDelayMillis

      public long getFixedDelayMillis()
      Fixed delay in milliseconds between retries (FIXED mode only). The same delay is used for all retry attempts.

    • getAttemptTimeout

      public Long getAttemptTimeout()
      Optional timeout in milliseconds for a single attempt (including retries within that attempt). If set, each individual request attempt will be subject to this timeout. If null, the cloud provider's default attempt timeout will be used.

    • getTotalTimeout

      public Long getTotalTimeout()
      Optional total timeout in milliseconds for all retry attempts combined. If set, the retry logic will stop retrying once this timeout is exceeded, even if maxAttempts has not been reached. If null, no total timeout limit is applied.
